BITCOIN_ADDRESS.description: A bitcoin address is an identifier of 26-35 alphanumeric characters, beginning with the number 1 or 3, that represents a possible destination for a bitcoin payment.

CIDR_BLOCK.description: CIDR (Classless Inter-Domain Routing) identifies a range of IP addresses, and was introduced as a way to allow more flexible allocation of Internet Protocol (IP) addresses than was possible with the original system of IP address classes.

CVE.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) system provides a reference-method for publicly known information-security vulnerabilities and exposures.

EMAIL_ADDRESS.description: An email address is a unique identifier for an email account.

INDICATOR_SUMMARY.description: Free text summary data related to an indicator. This should include a normalized score if one exists.

IP.description: An Internet Protocol address (IP address) is a numerical label assigned to each device participating in a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication.

MALWARE.description: Names of software that are intended to damage or disable computers and computer systems.

MD5.description: The MD5 algorithm is a widely used hash function producing a 128-bit hash value.

REGISTRY_KEY.description: The registry is a hierarchical database that contains data that is critical for the operation of Windows and the applications and services that run on Windows.

REPORT_LINK.description: A link to the TruSTAR report. Access may be restricted depending on user permissions.

SHA1.description: SHA-1 (Secure Hash Algorithm 1) is a cryptographic hash function which takes an input and produces a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value known as a message digest - typically rendered as a hexadecimal number, 40 digits long. SHA-1 is prone to length extension attacks.

SHA256.description: SHA-256 is a member of the SHA-2 cryptographic hash functions designed by the NSA, which are the successors to SHA-1. It is represented as a 64-character hexadecimal string.

SOFTWARE.description: The name of a file on a filesystem.

THREAT_ACTOR.description: A string identifying the threat actor.

URL.description: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) is a reference to a web resource that specifies its location on a computer network and a mechanism for retrieving it.
